'''Esprit Jouffret''' (1837 - 1904) was a [[France|French]] [[artillery]] officer,<ref>{{cite book |last=Jouffret |first=Esprit |title=Cours d'artillerie: Les projectiles |url=http://books.google.com/books?id=YqvmBPs5pHQC |accessdate=2008-07-22 |year=1881|publisher=École d'application de l'artillerie et du génie |location=Fontainebleau, France |language=French }}</ref> insurance [[actuary]] and [[mathematician]], author of ''Traité élémentaire de géométrie à quatre dimensions'' (''Elementary Treatise on the Geometry of Four Dimensions'', 1903),<ref>{{cite book |last=Jouffret |first=Esprit |title=Traité élémentaire de géométrie à quatre dimensions et introduction à la géométrie à n dimensions |url=http://historical.library.cornell.edu/cgi-bin/cul.math/docviewer?did=04810001 |accessdate=2008-07-22 |year=1903 |publisher=Gauthier-Villars |location=Paris |language=French |oclc=1445172 }}</ref> a popularization of [[Henri Poincaré]]'s ''[[Science and Hypothesis]]'' in which Jouffret described [[hypercube]]s and other complex [[Polyhedron|polyhedra]] in four [[dimension]]s and projected them onto the two-dimensional page.

[[Maurice Princet]] brought ''Traite'' to [[Picasso]]'s attention. Picasso's sketchbooks for ''[[Les Demoiselles d'Avignon]]'' illustrate Jouffret's influence on the artist's work.<ref>{{cite book |last=Miller |title=Einstein, Picasso |pages=106–117 }}</ref>
